---
title: "document-reference.ts"
---

## High-level description
This code defines types and utility functions for working with FHIR DocumentReference resources. It provides type safety and helper functions to check if a resource is a DocumentReference and if it has an ID.

## Symbols

### `DocumentReferenceWithId`
#### Description
A type that represents a DocumentReference with a required `id` field.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| N/A | N/A | This is a type definition, not a function |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| N/A | N/A | This is a type definition, not a function |

### `hasId`
#### Description
A type guard function that checks if a DocumentReference has an `id` field.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| docRef | DocumentReference | The DocumentReference to check |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| boolean | boolean | True if the DocumentReference has an id, false otherwise |

### `isDocumentReference`
#### Description
A type guard function that checks if a given resource is a DocumentReference.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| resource | Resource \| undefined | The resource to check |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| boolean | boolean | True if the resource is a DocumentReference, false otherwise |

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| @medplum/fhirtypes | Provides FHIR type definitions |

## References
This code is referenced in other parts of the codebase, particularly in functions that deal with DocumentReference resources. For example, the `getDocuments` function in `get-documents.ts` uses the `hasId` function to filter DocumentReference resources.

The `isDocumentReference` function is used in test files like `consolidated.test.part.ts` to identify DocumentReference resources in API responses.

These utility functions provide type safety and consistency when working with DocumentReference resources throughout the application.
